instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light But Not Turn ON
threads.message:
Hi Guys I have a problem with macbook pro 13 inch 2011 with board number <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> the unit just showing green light but not turning on

Power rails

<SIGNAL>PPGUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.57
PP3V42 =3.41
PPVRTC= 3.3
And other S0 is present 

but macbook won't turn on

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Green Light But Not Turn ON
threads.message:
"And other S0 is present"
Which exactly?
Do you get CPU voltages?
